title: About

text:
A LiveButton is a [[TiddlyButton]] that uses javascript to call Livecode. The `<$hello>` test-action widget is registered:

<$hello/>

TiddlyWiki does not directly support inline JavaScript execution via widgets. Instead, JavaScript must either be embedded in a custom plugin (or maybe executed via an appropriate API like tm-sendmessage???).

! Best Practice
The [[$:/plugins/custom/ExecuteJavaScript]] macro exports `exports.callLivecode = CallLivecodeWidget;`, which can be called in a button with `<$callLivecode>`. As you can see by the javascript this (currntly) simply calls the [[tiddlyButton_Call]] function in LiveCode. The idea I believe was to obtain a result in javascript - which as i remember is not going to work (yet). Here are some `callLivecode` button examples:

```
<$button>
  $callLivecode
  <$callLivecode/>
</$button>
```

<$button>
  $callLivecode
  <$callLivecode/>
</$button>

<$button>
  Send "Hello" with $callLivecode
  <$callLivecode message="Hello"/>
</$button>

<$vars dynamicMessage="This is a Dynamic Message from TW">
  <$button>
    Send Dynamic Message with $callLivecode
    <$callLivecode message=<<dynamicMessage>>/>
  </$button>
</$vars>

! Live Actions
Here are some examples of LiveButtons that interact with Livecode. These ones have been styled using the ShirazPlugin.

<$button type="button" class="btn btn-info btn-sm">
  EditScript of stack 'lib_TiddlyMessage'
  <$callLivecode message="EditScript stack 'lib_TiddlyMessage'"/>
</$button>

<$link overrideClass="btn btn-warning" to="Warning">Link to Warning</$link>

<$button type="button" class="btn btn-danger btn-sm">
  HkeyEdit 'C tiddlyButton_Call'
  <$callLivecode message="HkeyEdit 'C tiddlyButton_Call'"/>
</$button>

! See also
Some experiments regarding asynchrounous interacctions between LiveCode and TiddlyWiki:

* [[Experimental Messaging]]

The result of these tests are displayed in the [[Test]] tiddler, and sometimes logged in the [[test-log]] tiddler.

```
<$button>
  $wikiscript with Hello
  <$wikiscript message="Hello"/>
</$button>
```

See also work in progress using transclusion for multiline text only messages:

* [[Multiline LiveButton Messages]]
